title.narrative: ADVOCACY, COMMUNICATION AND PARTICIPATION

description.narrative: By 2022, the public sector, civil society, private sector, academia, media and adolescents have strengthened their dialogue and evidence based advocacy capacities for reaching social agreements towards the fulfillment of Children and Adolescent Rights and the reduction of their main inequalities., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Private Sector Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, the public sector, civil society, private sector, academia, media and adolescents have strengthened their dialogue and evidence based advocacy capacities for reaching social agreements towards the fulfillment of Children and Adolescent Rights and the reduction of their main inequalities.

related-activity.ref: 1020/A0/06/003 SOCIAL INCLUSION, PUBLIC ADVOCACY AND COMMUNICATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the public sector, civil society, private sector, academia, media and adolescents have strengthened their dialogue andevidence based advocacy capacities for reaching social agreements towards the fulfillment of Children and Adolescent Rights and thereduction of their main inequalities.

description.narrative: UNICEF&39;s advocacy and communication support were key to making Costa Rica one of the first countries in the region to achieve safe return to bimodal lessons in February. Strategy“Yo me cuido, yo te cuido, reached near of 8 million people with direct. UNICEF reach of more than 20 million people, 10K more followers in social media and more than 600 articles published in national and international media and the campaign for the regularization of migrant students contributed to the regularization of more than 2,400 children and adolescents. PAHO and UNICEF work together to prevent the COVID-19 and promote vaccination. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/01/2022

Instruments implemented for measuring the outreach, knowledge an d commitment of the population towards the fulfillment of children and adolescent rights and the UNICEF brand.(57834)

baseline.value: Baseline to be developed on the basis of the Global Strategy for Communication and Advocacy

target.value: 2022:By 2022, there is one or more measurement instruments implemented for each of the programme's component.

title.narrative: Developed and supported social agreements on children and adolescent's rights supported by political and social leaders, based on an action platform for the eradication of the main manifestations of exclusion and vulnerabilities that children and adolescents face.(57832)

baseline.value: Baseline to be developed within the framework of the agreements promoted in the UNDAF.

target.value: 2022:At least three social agreements on children and adolescent's issues signed by political leaders and society.

title.narrative: A Civil Society's advocacy plan elaborated.(57831)

baseline.value: Civil society advocacy mechanisms at the CNNA, ANNA, etc.

target.value: 2022:The Civil Society has been able to successfully participate and advocate its positions at the CNNA, ANNA, SDG working groups, among others.

title.narrative: Developed and implemented the Comptroller of Childhood and Adolescence Services.(57833), Text

baseline.value: Costa Rica doesn't has child services comptroller system

target.value: 2022:The country will have in operation a Comptroller for Child and Adolescent Services that improves the quality and outreach of public services for children and adolescents.

actual.value: 2021:Support was given, there was not political will.
